description: Erection of a two storey detached house with integral garage and car port
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  (B1, B5, 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9).  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings. | The flat roof to be created shall not be used to form a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area.  (B1, B5, H33, 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9).  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties. | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the local planning authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  (B2, ES4, 4.5).  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area. | The entire root system of the cedar and conifer trees to the southern end of the development site shall be protected by stout exclusion fencing with at least a 5m radius from the stems until completion of the development. Measures shall be taken to protect the trees to be retained on site from the mixing and run off of cement and chemicals in order to protect the soil and rooting zones.  Details of these measures shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development, and the protection measures as approved shall be implemented.  (B2, ES4, 4.5).  REASON: To prevent damage to the trees in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area. | Sight lines of 2.4m+ 2.4m shall be provided and that land shall be kept clear of any obstructions to visibility above a height of 0.6m. (B12A, 5.9).  REASON: In the interest of highway safety. | The proposed windows on the first floor southern and western elevations and the windows in the western roof space shall be obscurely glazed. The first floor window on the southern elevation shall be permanently fixed shut and details of opening of the first floor windows on the western elevation and a sample of the obscured glass, no smaller than 300mm square shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development, and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the opening details and sample thus approved.   The details so approved shall be retained permanently.  (B1, B5, H33, 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9).  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties. (B1, B5, H33, 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Class(es) A, B, C D, and E of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no additions or extensions to the dwellinghouse or additions and extensions to the roof of the dwellinghouse or alterations to the shape of the dwellinghouse or erection or construction of a porch outside any external door of the dwellinghouse or provision within the curtilage of the dwellinghouse  of any building or enclosure.  (B1, B5, ES2, H26, H33, Supplementary Guidance 3 - Garden Space, 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9).  REASON: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building. | The existing cross-over as shown on the approved plan 03A (07 May 2002) shall be reinstated as a footpath prior to first occupation of any part of the development.  REASON:  To ensure that there is no over provision of car parking and in the interest of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with UDP Policies T50, T63 and RUDP Policies 5.9, 9.1 and Appendix One Table and Notes on Parking Requirements | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.   The boundary treatment shall be completed before the building is occupied.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter retained.  REASON:  To protect the appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with UDP Policies B1, B5, H33 and RUDP Policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9. | The garage accommodation shall not be used for living purposes.   REASON:  To ensure that adequate parking accommodation is retained within the site, in accordance with UDP Policies T50, T63 and RUDP Policies 9.1, Appendix One   Table and Notes on Parking Requirements). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  (B1, B5, ES2, ES6, H33, 4.1, 5.5, 5.9).  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area.
